section.name: Determine the scope and complexity of the problem

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Completely

values.name: a
values.desc: Described the problem that needed to be solved and the decision needed to be made.

values.name: b
values.desc: Listed complicating factors or constraints that may be important to consider when developing a solution.

values.name: c
values.desc: Identified the potential consequences to stakeholders or surroundings.
Read closely, and write down short summaries as you read through the entire context of the problem.
Draw a schematic or diagram that shows how aspects of the problem relate to one another.
Brainstorm or identify possible factors or constraints that are inherent or may be related to the stated problem or given situation.
Prioritize the complicating factors from most to least important.
List anything that will be significantly impacted by your decision (such as conditions, objects, or people).
List anything that will be significantly impacted by your decision (such as conditions, objects, or people).

section.name: Determined the information, tools, and resources necessary to solve the problem.

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Completely

values.name: a
values.desc: Reviewed and organized the necessary information and resources.

values.name: b
values.desc: Evaluated which available information and resources are critical to solving the problem.

values.name: c
values.desc: Determined the limitations of the tools or information that was given or gathered.

values.name: d
values.desc: .Identified reliable sources that may provide additional needed information, tools, or resources.
Highlight or annotate the provided information that may be needed to solve the problem.
List information or principles that you already know that can help you solve the problem.
Sort the given and gathered information/resources as “useful” or “not useful.”.
List the particular limitations of the provided information or tools.
Identify ways to access any additional reliable information, tools or resources that you might need.

section.name: Developed a process (series of steps) to arrive at a solution

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Completely

values.name: a
values.desc: Identified potential starting and ending points for the strategy.

values.name: b
values.desc: Determined general steps needed to get from starting.

values.name: c
values.desc: Sequenced or mapped actions in a logical progression.
Write down a reasonable place to start and add a reasonable end goal.
Align any two steps in the order or sequence that they must happen. Then, add a third step and so on.
Consider starting at the end goal and working backwards.
Sketch a flowchart indicating some general steps from start to finish.
Add links/actions, or processes that connect the steps.

section.name: Judged the reasonableness and completeness of the proposed strategy or solution

values.desc: No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Completely

values.name: a
values.desc: Reviewed strategy with respect to the identified scope.

values.name: b
values.desc: Provided rationale as to how steps within the process were properly sequenced.

values.name: c
values.desc: Identified ways the process or strategy could be further improved or optimized.

values.name: d
values.desc: Evaluated the practicality of the overall strategy.
Summarize the problem succinctly - does your strategy address each aspect of the problem?
Identify any steps that must occur in a specific order and verify that they do.
Check each step in your strategy. Is each step necessary? Can it be shortened or optimized in some way?
Check each step in your strategy. Is each step feasible? What evidence supports this?
Check to see if you have access to necessary resources, and if not, propose substitutes.
Check that your strategy is practical and functional, with respect to time, cost, safety, personnel, regulations, etc.
Take time to continuously assess your strategy throughout the process.
No evidence
Minimally
Partially
Completely

values.name: a
values.desc: Used data and information correctly.

values.name: b
values.desc: Made assumptions about the use of data and information that are justifiable.

values.name: c
values.desc: Determined that each step is being done in the order and the manner that was planned.

values.name: d
values.desc: Verified that each step in the process was providing the desired outcome.
Use authentic values and reasonable estimates for information needed to solve the problem.
Make sure that the information you are using applies to the conditions of the problem.
List the assumptions that you are making and provide a reason for why those are valid assumptions.
Double check that you are following all the steps in your strategy.
List any barriers that you are encountering in executing the steps.
Identify ways to overcome barriers in implementation steps of the strategy.
Check the outcome of each step of the strategy for effectiveness.
